medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 weeks before admission with headaches, blurred vision, nausea, vomiting, anorexia, and weight loss. Three days prior to admission, symptoms progressed to photophobia, diplopia, neck stiffness, tremulousness of the left hand, and somnolence. The patient became mute on the day of admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Surgery at 11 years of age for eustachian-tube dysfunction. History of falling while snowboarding two months before admission.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had a prolonged illness requiring multiple medications while in a refugee camp; sisters were healthy. No family history of autoimmune diseases or cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol consumption; did not smoke or use illicit drugs. Student living with a roommate.
